name: MeasureReport
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Quality Information)

element.definition: The MeasureReport resource contains the results of evaluating a measure.
The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation. Bundles always have an id, though it is usually a generated UUID.

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. element.definition: A reference to the Measure that was evaluated to produce this report.

The type of measure report. This may be an individual report, which provides a single patient's score for the measure, a patient listing, which returns the list of patients that meet the various criteria in the measure, or a summary report, which returns a population count for each criteria in the measure.

binding.description: The type of the measure report

element.definition: Optional Patient if the report was requested for a single patient.
The reporting period for which the report was calculated.
The report status. No data will be available until the report status is complete.

binding.description: The status of the measure report

element.definition: The date this measure report was generated.
Reporting Organization.
The results of the calculation, one for each population group in the measure.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: Identifier of the population group being reported
element.definition: The identifier of the population group as defined in the measure definition.
The populations that make up the population group, one for each type of population appropriate for the measure.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: initial-population | numerator | numerator-exclusion | denominator | denominator-exclusion | denominator-exception | measure-population | measure-population-exclusion | measure-score
element.definition: The type of the population.

binding.description: The type of population (e.g. initial, numerator, denominator, etc.)

element.definition: The number of members of the population.

element.short: For patient-list reports, the patients in this population
element.definition: This element refers to a List of patient level MeasureReport resources, one for each patient in this population.
The measure score.
When a measure includes multiple stratifiers, there will be a stratifier group for each stratifier defined by the measure.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: The identifier of this stratifier, as defined in the measure definition.

element.short: Stratum results, one for each unique value in the stratifier
element.definition: This element contains the results for a single stratum within the stratifier. For example, when stratifying on administrative gender, there will be four strata, one for each possible gender value.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: The value for this stratum, expressed as a string. When defining stratifiers on complex values, the value must be rendered such that the value for each stratum within the stratifier is unique.
The populations that make up the stratum, one for each type of population appropriate to the measure.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: initial-population | numerator | numerator-exclusion | denominator | denominator-exclusion | denominator-exception | measure-population | measure-population-exclusion | measure-score
element.definition: The type of the population.

binding.description: The type of population (e.g. initial, numerator, denominator, etc.)

element.definition: The number of members of the population in this stratum.

element.short: For patient-list reports, the patients in this population
element.definition: This element refers to a List of patient level MeasureReport resources, one for each patient in this population in this stratum.
The measure score for this stratum.

element.short: Supplemental data elements for the measure
element.definition: Supplemental data elements for the measure provide additional information requested by the measure for each patient involved in the populations.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.short: Identifier of the supplemental data element
element.definition: The identifier of the supplemental data element as defined in the measure.

element.short: Supplemental data results, one for each unique supplemental data value
element.definition: This element contains the results for a single value within the supplemental data. For example, when reporting supplemental data for administrative gender, there will be four groups, one for each possible gender value.
unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.definition: The value for this supplemental data element, expressed as a string.  When defining supplemental data  on complex values, the value must be rendered such that the value for each group within the supplemental data element is unique.

element.short: Number of members in the group
element.definition: The number of members in the supplemental data group.

element.short: For patient-list reports, the patients in this population
element.definition: This element refers to a List of patient level MeasureReport resources, one for each patient in this population.
A reference to a Bundle containing the Resources that were used in the evaluation of this report.
The MeasureReport resource contains the results of evaluating a measure.
